intro: Rudgea breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves, and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
